TEXT:
MUSIQUE - Si c'est fait exprÃ¨s, c'est du gÃ©nie. Le prochain album d'Eminem est attendu comme le messie par des millions d'amoureux de musique et de rap dans le monde. On comprend mieux pourquoi une thÃ©orie autour du titre du neuviÃ¨me disque de Marshall Bruce Mathers fait tourner les tÃªtes.

C'est une simple photo postÃ©e sur le compte Instagram de son manager de toujours, Paul Rosenberg, qui a mis la puce Ã  l'oreille d'un fan. Sur le rÃ©seau Reddit ce mercredi 25 octobre, cet internaute dit avoir dÃ©nichÃ© sur cette publication plusieurs dÃ©tails qui donnent Ã  croire que le titre de son prochain album sera: "Revival".

Look what arrived at the Shady offices today! @Yelawolf TRIAL BY FIRE comes out this Friday 10/27! #cdbaby Une publication partagÃ©e par Paul Rosenberg (@rosenberg) le 25 Oct. 2017 Ã  13h26 PDT

A premiÃ¨re vue, cette image n'est qu'une banale photo de promotion du dernier album de Yelawolf, un rappeur produit par Shady Records, la maison de production d'Eminem. Mais la photo, prise depuis les bureaux du label montre en arriÃ¨re plan un immense panneau publicitaire pour la marque RÆVIVAL. Oui, le Æ est Ã  l'envers, comme dans EMINÆM.

Une simple recherche sur Google a permis Ã  l'internaute de Reddit de trouver que le panneau en question a Ã©tÃ© commandÃ© et payÃ© par Interscope, un label amÃ©ricain de musique rattachÃ© Ã  celui d'Eminem qui a rÃ©cemment fait parler de lui avec un freestyle anti-Trump.

Mais ce n'est pas tout. Comme l'explique le site Uproxx.com, cette affiche contient bien d'autres indices. Sous le nom de la marque en bas Ã  droite est Ã©crit Canticum remedium, traduction en latin de "le remÃ¨de de la chanson". A droite du logo de Revival, on remarque aussi un signal d'ondes sonores.

Sur le site internet de ce mystÃ©rieux mÃ©dicament, on peut lire en pied de page que "Revival ne provoque pas d'effet secondaire, mais si vous en avez n'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  consulter un mÃ©decin, "I need a doctor". Oui, c'est aussi une rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  la collaboration entre Dr. Dre et Eminem en 2011. Dans ses chansons et ses prÃ©cÃ©dents album, ce dernier a multipliÃ© les rÃ©fÃ©rences Ã  la santÃ©, aux mÃ©dicaments et aux hÃ´pitaux comme l'attestent le clip "The Real Slim Shady", ses album "Relapse" ("rechute") et "Recovery" ("guÃ©rison").

D'aprÃ¨s plusieurs mÃ©dias, le numÃ©ro 1-833-243-8738 prÃ©sent sur l'affiche renvoie vers une boÃ®te vocale qui joue la chanson "I need a doctor". Une voix prend alors le relais et dit: "Merci pour votre intÃ©rÃªt pour Revival, le traitement invasif numÃ©ro un pour l'Atrox Rithimus", une maladie fictive qui peut se traduire du latin "terrible rythme".

La voix conclut avec cette phrase:"You only get one shot to beat AR", une rÃ©fÃ©rence aux paroles de la chanson "Lose Yourself" d'Eminem. Une rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  cette chanson que l'on retrouve dans la publicitÃ© ci-dessous de Revival qui a tout de la parodie, mais aussi dans les symptÃ´mes de la maladie imaginaire listÃ©s sur le site internet du mÃ©dicament comme "mains moites" ou "dommage cÃ©rÃ©bral".

Tout ceci semble trop gros pour n'Ãªtre qu'une sÃ©rie de fabuleuses coÃ¯ncidences. Autre raison de croise en cette thÃ©orie: Eminem avait dÃ©jÃ  montÃ© ce type de stratagÃ¨me pour dÃ©voiler son album "Relapse" en 2009. Le rappeur avait crÃ©Ã© le site internet "Celebrity rehab" faisant la promotion d'une clinique appelÃ©e "Popsomp Industries"... que l'on retrouve huit ans plus tard en pied de page du site Revival. VoilÃ  voilÃ .

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Cette thÃ©orie sur le prochain album d'Eminem est complÃ¨tement folle (mais plausible)

Le message dÃ©livrÃ© par cette campagne publicitaire, comme quoi une jeune femme n'est rien sans un compagnon, a Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s mal reÃ§u, notamment par les internautes. SUMMARY:
Another woman has come forward to level allegations of sexual assault against Harvey Weinstein.
Shortly after that job wrapped up, Weinstein asked Haleyi to accompany him to Paris, she said.
After his return for Paris, Haleyi said she agreed to meet him at his apartment in Manhattan.
Since then, he has been accused of harassment and sexual assault by dozens of women, with allegations including rape and forcing women to watch him masturbate.
A spokeswoman for Weinstein has previously said that â€œany allegations of non-consensual sex are unequivocally deniedâ€ by him.
TEXT:
Another woman has come forward to level allegations of sexual assault against Harvey Weinstein.

Mimi Haleyi, a former production assistant for the Weinstein Co., accused the Hollywood mogul of forcing himself on her and orally sexually assaulting her in 2006 while she was on her period.

She spoke Tuesday at a news conference in New York with her lawyer, Gloria Allred. Allred is also representing other Weinstein accusers, former actresses Louisette Geiss and Heather Kerr.

Haleyi said she first met Weinstein in 2004 while in her 20s at the London premier of the film â€œThe Aviator.â€ She said their paths crossed again in 2006 at the Cannes Film Festival and that she broached the prospect of working for his company. Weinstein invited her to meet him at his hotel room, which she did one afternoon, she said.

After â€œa few minutes of normal conversation,â€ he tried to persuade her to give him a massage, she said. Instead, she said she left.

â€œBy that time I was crying, as I felt completely humiliated and stupid for having been excited about meeting with him,â€ Haleyi said.

After the incident, she said Weinstein got in touch with her and she went to work on one of his companyâ€™s television shows in New York. Shortly after that job wrapped up, Weinstein asked Haleyi to accompany him to Paris, she said.

â€œI declined, as this seemed like an invitation of a romantic nature,â€ she said. â€œHe didnâ€™t like that answer.â€

Weinstein allegedly showed up to her apartment in New York and â€œphysically forced himself in through the door, pleading with me to come to Paris,â€ she said, but she continued to decline.

After his return for Paris, Haleyi said she agreed to meet him at his apartment in Manhattan. â€œI wanted to maintain a good relationship with him,â€ she said.

They watched television for a few minutes, but soon â€œhe was all over me, making sexual advances,â€ she said.

â€œI said, â€˜I am on my period. There is no way this is going to happen. Please stop.â€™ He wouldnâ€™t take no for an answer,â€ Haleyi said.

Weinstein allegedly backed her into a room â€œwhich was not lit but looked like a kidâ€™s bedroom with kidsâ€™ drawings on the wall,â€ she said.

â€œHe held me on the bed, I tried to get him off me but â€¦ he was extremely persistent and physically overpowering,â€ she said. â€œHe orally forced himself on me while I was on my period. He even pulled my tampon out. I was mortified. I was in disbelief and disgusted.â€

After the alleged assault, Haleyi said Weinstein rolled over on his back and said â€œDonâ€™t you feel like weâ€™re so much closer now?â€

â€œNo,â€ she said she replied.

A New York Times story earlier this month first disclosed sexual harassment complaints against Weinstein spanning decades. A New Yorker story followed days later with more allegations. Since then, he has been accused of harassment and sexual assault by dozens of women, with allegations including rape and forcing women to watch him masturbate.

A spokeswoman for Weinstein has previously said that â€œany allegations of non-consensual sex are unequivocally deniedâ€ by him.
TITLE: Former Employee Says Weinstein 'Orally Forced Himself On Me' While She Was Menstruating

SUMMARY:
An A&E nurse has claimed controversial new checks for peopleâ€™s eligibility for NHS treatment delayed him in arranging treatment for an elderly woman with sepsis.
The delay lasted around 20 minutes, he told HuffPost UK, adding that this was â€œproportionately bigâ€ because of the need to quickly administer antibiotics to people with sepsis.
Sepsis is a potentially fatal condition, which, The UK Sepsis Trust warns, can lead to â€œmulti-organ failure, septic shock and deathâ€.
The policy has attracted the ire of doctors who fear the administrative burden of checking peopleâ€™s eligibility for treatment could test an already stretched workforce and endanger patient safety.
He said of the woman he was helping with sepsis: â€œI was delayed in treating her for those forms to be filled out.
TEXT:
An A&E nurse has claimed controversial new checks for peopleâ€™s eligibility for NHS treatment delayed him in arranging treatment for an elderly woman with sepsis. The nurse said he was preparing to book in the woman for a chest x-ray after she arrived at the Royal London Hospital by ambulance last week but added he could not proceed until a form had been completed, establishing she was a British resident and therefore eligible to be treated for free. The delay lasted around 20 minutes, he told HuffPost UK, adding that this was â€œproportionately bigâ€ because of the need to quickly administer antibiotics to people with sepsis. Sepsis is a potentially fatal condition, which, The UK Sepsis Trust warns, can lead to â€œmulti-organ failure, septic shock and deathâ€.

PA Archive/PA Images The nurse told HuffPost eligibility checks for his patent at Royal London Hospital delayed her treatment by 20 minutes

From Monday, NHS policy changed so that people who are not resident in Britain must now pay upfront for non-urgent hospital treatment while British residents must prove their eligibility. The policy has attracted the ire of doctors who fear the administrative burden of checking peopleâ€™s eligibility for treatment could test an already stretched workforce and endanger patient safety. Royal London Hospital has been part of a trial in the process and the nurse, who does want to be named, said he has started to see people required to complete the forms in A&E within the last two weeks. While urgent care remains still free to all, the nurse said A&E was such a common point of entry for patients that its reception staff used it as a point to determine peopleâ€™s eligibility for any care they may receive after emergency treatment. He said of the woman he was helping with sepsis: â€œI was delayed in treating her for those forms to be filled out. â€œShe was dropped off by the ambulance... [I was] doing bits and bobs, getting her sorted out, and then reception staff came back with a form saying â€™we canâ€™t put you onto the system until youâ€™ve filled in this form, you need to tell us where you live and tell us your address, tell us this, tell us that. â€³â€˜You need to make sure you donâ€™t have to pay for the careâ€™.â€

Docs Not Cops A Docs Not Cops protest against the new policy on Monday

The nurse called this â€œan inhumane and inappropriate way really to administer checksâ€. He added: â€œIt was new and surprising to me and it felt very inappropriate.â€ When the nurseâ€™s description of what happened was put to Barts Health, the hospitalâ€™s parent trust, a spokeswoman said: â€œWe take pride in providing vital care to all our patients and anyone requiring urgent and emergency care will receive the care that they need. â€œLike all NHS trusts we already have a responsibility to recover the cost of some treatment and we are working closely with national bodies to make sure we comply with their new regulations.â€ She added: â€œOur staff will follow national guidance to identify and record all patients who may be liable to charges, including in A&E, however care provided in A&E is always without charge.â€
TITLE: A&E Nurse Describes 'Inhumane' Way Woman With Sepsis Was Treated 'Due To Anti-Health Tourism Policy'

TEXT:
Muslime haben besonders groÃŸes Vertrauen in die EU - das ist Grund | Osman Orsal / Reuters

Laut einer Studie sind Muslime zufriedener mit der EU als AngehÃ¶rige anderer Religionen

Allerdings sinkt die Zufriedenheit, je lÃ¤nger die Muslime bereits in der EU leben

Muslime in Europa halten im Vergleich zu den AngehÃ¶rigen anderer Religionen besonders viel von der EuropÃ¤ischen Union (EU). Das geht aus einer neuen Studie der UniversitÃ¤t MÃ¼nster hervor, deren Ergebnisse am Freitag verÃ¶ffentlicht wurden.

Auf die Frage, wie groÃŸ ihr Vertrauen in das EuropÃ¤ische Parlament ist, gaben europÃ¤ische Muslime auf einer Skala von 1 bis 10 im Schnitt einen Wert von 5,2 an. Zum Vergleich: Bei den Katholiken etwa lag der Wert bei 4,5, bei den Protestanten bei 4,7. Juden gaben im Schnitt 4,7 an.

Warum die Muslime die EU so gut bewertet haben

"Ein Grund fÃ¼r die mehrheitlich positive Einstellung bei europÃ¤ischen Muslimen ist, dass sie mit ihrer Lebenssituation in der EU zufriedener sind als andere", erklÃ¤rte einer der Studienautoren, Bernd Schlipphak, am Freitag.

Wichtig zur EinschÃ¤tzung ist aber: Die Forscher beziehen sich auf die aktuellsten Daten des European Social Survey (ESS) von 2002 bis 2014 - die Studie endet also vor dem Brexit und der FlÃ¼chtlingskrise. Verzerrungen kÃ¶nnen sich bei der Studie dadurch ergeben, dass mÃ¶glicherweise nur Migranten die FragebÃ¶gen beantwortet haben, die die Landessprache gut verstanden.

Die Euphorie nimmt ab

Allerdings gibt es deutliche Unterschiede zwischen der ersten und zweiten Generation europÃ¤ischer Muslime.

EuropÃ¤ische Muslime der zweiten Einwanderergeneration hÃ¤tten weniger Vertrauen in die politischen Institutionen der EU als europÃ¤ische Muslime der ersten, erklÃ¤rte Schlipphak.

Als erste Generation wurden in der Studie alle Muslime verstanden, die in einem anderen Land geboren wurden, als zweite Generation jene, die mindestens ein Elternteil haben, das in einem anderen Land geboren wurde.

Die Zufriedenheitswerte werden laut Schlipphak geringer, je lÃ¤nger die Migrationserfahrung zurÃ¼ckliegt. AuÃŸerdem vertrauen auf die EU vor allem jene Muslime der zweiten Generation seltener, die Diskriminierungserfahrungen gemacht haben.



(lp)
TITLE: Muslime haben besonders groÃŸes Vertrauen in die EU - das ist der Grund

"Pas si mauvais"Ce qui n'empÃªche pas des initiatives de se dÃ©velopper en attendant que les lÃ©gislations des divers pays se mettent en place.
Quant Ã  la chaÃ®ne Huxtaburger, elle n'en est pas Ã  son coup d'essai.

TEXT:
HALLOWEEN - Les dÃ©guisements, les chasses aux bonbons, les films d'horreur ne suffisent plus pour fÃªter Halloween. Une chaÃ®ne de burger australienne a dÃ©cidÃ© de cÃ©lÃ©brer cette fÃªte en crÃ©ant un "Bugstaburger", comme le relayait le site Mashable ce jeudi 26 octobre. En version franÃ§aise: un hamburger aux insectes.

La chaÃ®ne Huxtaburger a annoncÃ© ce nouveau sandwich, Ã  l'aspect peu avenant, sur son compte Instagram et sa page Facebook. Il ne sera disponible que ce mardi 31 octobre, le jour d'Halloween, dans un seul de ses cinq restaurants sur Melbourne.

La recette du sandwich? Des pains Ã  burger bleu, avec de la salade, des tomates, des oignons et des cornichons... Mais surtout, ces hamburgers sont fourrÃ©s de vers Ã  farine grillÃ©s et d'une mayonnaise aux fourmis. "Nous l'avons testÃ©", encouragent les cuisiniers de la chaÃ®ne sur leur publication.

Les recettes Ã  base d'insectes deviennent de plus en plus populaires. En Australie, selon un rapport de l'organisation des Nations unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture, la consommation d'insectes est limitÃ©e par des problÃ¨mes de rÃ©colte des insectes et d'approvisionnement, mais aussi -et surtout- par la rÃ©pugnance des populations vis-Ã -vis de cet aliment peu commun.

En France, un sÃ©nateur avait interpellÃ© le gouvernement en 2016 pour lÃ©galiser leur vente. Sous rÃ©serve d'autorisation prÃ©alable, leur vente sera rendue possible Ã  partir de janvier 2018, rÃ©pondait alors le SecrÃ©tariat d'Ã‰tat chargÃ© de la consommation, avec l'adoption d'un nouveau rÃ¨glement europÃ©en dÃ©diÃ© aux "nouveaux aliments".

"Pas si mauvais"

Ce qui n'empÃªche pas des initiatives de se dÃ©velopper en attendant que les lÃ©gislations des divers pays se mettent en place. Ainsi, deux Autrichiennes ont crÃ©Ã© en 2016 une ruche pour Ã©lever chez soi des vers Ã  farine. De quoi Ã©lever ses propres larves, pour ensuite prÃ©parer ses propres burgers maison, sans prendre un billet pour l'Australie.

"La premiÃ¨re Ã©tape, c'est d'oublier que l'on mange un insecte", confiait auprÃ¨s de l'AFP la critique gastronomique Alexandra Palla. "Ensuite, on se rend compte que ce n'est pas si mauvais." De son cÃ´tÃ©, dans un rapport publiÃ© en 2013, l'organisation des Nations unies pour l'alimentation et l'agriculture encourageait Ã  la consommation d'insectes, une "source d'alimentation saine et trÃ¨s riche en nutriments".

Quant Ã  la chaÃ®ne Huxtaburger, elle n'en est pas Ã  son coup d'essai. Elle avait ainsi conÃ§u un burger Ã  la glace et Ã  la gelÃ©e au coca, filmÃ© par The Urban List, et dont l'aspect n'est pas franchement plus engageant.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Pour Halloween, une chaÃ®ne australienne propose un hamburger aux insectes

TEXT:

In WÃ¼rzburg soll eine Professorin eine Studentin mit Kopftuch diskriminiert haben

Die GrÃ¼ne Jugend zeigte sich Ã¼ber den Vorfall sehr empÃ¶rt

Laut der GrÃ¼nen Jugend soll eine Professorin in WÃ¼rzburg eine Studentin aufgrund ihres Kopftuchs diskriminiert haben.

In einer EinfÃ¼hrungsveranstaltung soll die Professorin Gisela MÃ¼ller-Brandeck-Bocquet eine Debatte Ã¼ber die Respektlosigkeit jeder Art von Kopfbedeckungen in VorlesungssÃ¤len begonnen haben.

Die Professorin ist laut der GrÃ¼nen Jugend WÃ¼rzburg der Meinung, dass auch KopftÃ¼cher aus religiÃ¶sen GrÃ¼nden respektlos seien und vom Inhalt der Vorlesung ablenken wÃ¼rden.

Die GrÃ¼ne Jugend ist empÃ¶rt Ã¼ber den Vorfall

Die GrÃ¼ne Jugend zeigt sich sehr empÃ¶rt Ã¼ber die Aussagen der Inhaberin der Professur fÃ¼r Europaforschung und Internationale Beziehungen.

Magdalena Bachinger, Beisitzerin im Vorstand der GrÃ¼nen Jugend, sagte der Website â€œWÃ¼rzburg Erlebenâ€, dass es vielmehr respektlos und ablenkend sei, wegen eines Kopftuchs eine Vorlesung zu unterbrechen.

Die Aufforderung, das Kopftuch wÃ¤hrend der Vorlesung abzunehmen, sei an einer Ã¶ffentlichen Einrichtung, die tolerant, weltoffen und diskriminierungsfrei sein sollte, nicht tragbar.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Mit Kopftuch leider nicht" - was ich als Muslima auf Jobsuche erlebte

â€œWir empfinden das Verhalten der Professorin als Ã¶ffentliche DemÃ¼tigung. Das Kopftuch ist Teil einer individuellen ReligionsausÃ¼bung. Dieses zu verbieten, ist diskriminierend, abwertend und verstÃ¶ÃŸt sowohl gegen die in Deutschland festgelegte Religionsfreiheit, das Grundgesetz als auch das Selbstbestimmungsrecht von Frauenâ€, fÃ¼gte Bachinger hinzu.

Hinweise der Studierenden auf Religionsfreiheit soll die Professorin mit der ErklÃ¤rung abgetan haben, dass eine solche in der Gesellschaft herrschen kann, nicht aber in der Wissenschaft.

Ein GroÃŸteil der Studierenden soll daraufhin aus Protest die Vorlesung der Professorin verlassen haben.

Auf eine Anfrage der HuffPost zu dem Vorfall hat die UniversitÃ¤t WÃ¼rzburg bisher noch nicht reagiert.

Die Webseite "Islamiq" verwies am spÃ¤ten Nachmittag auf eine Mitteilung der UniversitÃ¤t. Die Professorin werde darin mit dem Satz zitiert: "Seit vielen Jahren pflege ich in meinen Vorlesungen die ZuhÃ¶rer um die Abnahme von Kopfbedeckungen zu bitten, als Zeichen des Respekts vor einer universitÃ¤ren Einrichtung und vor mir als vortragender Professorin.â€œ Damit seien in der Regel MÃ¤nner gemeint, die Kappen trÃ¼gen.

Als sie die Studentin aufgefordert habe, im Zuge der Gleichberechtigung ihr Kopftuch abzulegen, habe die Studentin Kritik geÃ¤uÃŸert.

WÃ¤hrend eines heftigen Gewitters in Oklahoma am 6. Oktober ging der Amerikaner Paul Smith mit seiner Kamera nach drauÃŸen, um zu filmen. Doch statt eines gewÃ¶hnlichen Gewitters, entdeckte er etwas Faszinierenderes am Himmel - sogenannte Kobold-Blitze.

Weit Ã¼ber der Wolkendecke flackerten rote Lichtblitze auf - fÃ¼r den Bruchteil einer Sekunde. Flugzeugpiloten hatten den Spuk frÃ¼her schon hÃ¤ufig beobachtet. Einige hielten die FeuerbÃ¤lle sogar fÃ¼r UFOs. 1989 fand die NASA auf den Aufnahmen eines Shuttles dann den Beweis, dass sie existieren - es sich dabei aber um ein seltenes WetterphÃ¤nomen handelt.

Kobold-Blitze kÃ¶nnten das Klima negativ beeinflussen

Kobold-Blitze treten nur zusammen mit besonders heftigen Blitzen auf. Wie bei normalen Blitzen leiten die â€œRoten Koboldeâ€ elektrische Ladung von den Wolken ab und schlieÃŸen so einen Stromkreis. Aber nicht zwischen Wolken und Erde, sondern zwischen Wolken und der Grenze zum All.

In der Regel bestehen die Blitze aus kreisrunden SÃ¤ulen, die bis zu 100 Kilometer nach oben ausschlagen kÃ¶nnen. Forscher der UniversitÃ¤t Alaska Fairbanks vermuten auch, dass die Kobold-Blitze das Klima negativ beeinflussen kÃ¶nnten.

Die Satiriker legen mit einem "Baby-Hitler"-Titelblatt nach

Wer glaubte, krasser wird es nicht, denn mussten die Macher des Satiremagazins "Titanic" enttÃ¤uschen.

Nach dem ersten viel diskutierten "Baby-Hitler tÃ¶ten"-Witz, mit dem sich die Satiriker bitterbÃ¶se Ã¼ber den Ã¶sterreichischen Wahlgewinner Sebastian Kurz lustig gemacht hatten, legte das Magazin am Freitag nach.

"Je mehr sie mit ihrer Satire polarisieren, umso mehr Hefte verkaufen sie auch", analysierte die "Krone". Das BrÃ¼ssler Polit-Magazin "Politico" widmete dem "Titanic"-Cover ebenfalls einen Artikel. "Deutsches Satiremagazin eskaliert den Baby-Hitler-Skandal", schrieb "Politico".

In Ã–sterreich hat Sebastian Kurz mit seiner Ã–VP die Koalitionsverhandlungen mit der rechtsextremen FPÃ– aufgenommen. "Es war eine positive Runde, es war eine positive AtmosphÃ¤re", sagte Kurz am Mittwoch in Wien.

SUMMARY:
Finance Minister Bill Morneau speaks to reporters in the foyer of the House of Commons on Parliament Hill on Oct. 26, 2017.
It's shocking'Cullen noted that prior to entering politics, when Morneau headed Morneau Shepell, the company lobbied for the use of the plans.
Ethics Commissioner Mary Dawson leaves after appearing as a witness at a Commons committee on Parliament Hill on Oct. 17, 2017.
The code stipulates that MPs must disclose orally or in writing their private interest and register it with the clerk of the House.
And MPs shouldn't vote or participate in matters on which they have a private interest.
TEXT:
Finance Minister Bill Morneau speaks to reporters in the foyer of the House of Commons on Parliament Hill on Oct. 26, 2017.

OTTAWA â€” The federal ethics watchdog has never proactively checked whether public office holders with potential conflicts of interests are actually recusing themselves from decisions that could place them in an actual conflict, HuffPost Canada has learned.

In her 10 years in office, Mary Dawson, the House of Commons' conflict of interest and ethics commissioner, has only once investigated whether an MP failed to do so because of a conflict â€” and that was after a complaint was lodged by another MP, her spokesperson told HuffPost.

"You asked whether the Commissioner has investigated a member for not recusing himself or herself formally (by filling a recusal) or informally (by not showing up to votes or debates) because of a conflict," Margot Booth, the communications and outreach manager for Dawson's office wrote in an email to HuffPost. "The Commissioner has undertaken one inquiry in relation to a failure to recuse, the Thibault Inquiry in 2008."

Dawson has never investigated a cabinet minister.

Watch: New Democrats bash Morneau:

On Thursday, she announced she will "follow up" with Finance Minister Bill Morneau over his apparent conflict of interest regarding Bill C-27, a pension bill that appears to benefit his family's company, Morneau Shepell â€” whose stock Morneau still holds. The finance minister pledged last week to place his approximately one million shares in a blind trust in preparation for divesting them through an arm's-length process.

Under fire Thursday for benefiting from an increase of more than $5.5 million in the value of his shares since he took office in 2015, Morneau announced that he will donate that money to charity.

Earlier this month, NDP ethics critic Nathan Cullen wrote to Dawson, asking her to examine Morneau's apparent conflicts.

He suggested there was "substantial evidence" that Morneau was profiting from decisions he was making in cabinet, such as sponsoring Bill C-27, a bill that permits the establishment of target benefit plans.

' The appearance of conflict of interest is worrisome. It's shocking'

Cullen noted that prior to entering politics, when Morneau headed Morneau Shepell, the company lobbied for the use of the plans. In 2014 briefing note, the company claims credit for a target benefit pension plan framework that the federal finance department â€” under the previous Conservative government â€” proposed, noting that it closely resembled the shared risk plans Morneau Shepell had designed for the New Brunswick government.

"The appearance of conflict of interest is worrisome. It's shocking," Cullen said.

Morneau confirmed last week, during an interview on CBC Radio's The House, that he never recused himself from decisions regarding Bill C-27.

He told reporters that he twice recused himself from meetings but doesn't know what was discussed at the meetings or why he was asked to step out. (He also failed to register those recusals, as the law stipulates.)

Morneau has a conflict of interest screen that prevents him from engaging in very specific discussions that deal with Morneau Shepell, but not the pension administration sector writ large.

Ethics Commissioner Mary Dawson leaves after appearing as a witness at a Commons committee on Parliament Hill on Oct. 17, 2017.

Dawson didn't clearly say Thursday that she would launch an examination, as the Conflict of Interest Act stipulates. She wrote to Cullen saying that his letter left her "with concerns in relation to Mr. Morneau's involvement with Bill C-27.

"Consequently, I will follow up with Mr. Morneau and will inform you of the outcome in due course."

The only time Dawson has ever investigated a member of Parliament over a failure to withdraw from consideration of an issue because of a conflict was in 2008.

Back then, Conservative MP David Tilson had complained to Dawson's office that his colleague, Liberal MP Robert Thibault, should have recused himself from a committee review of the former prime minister Brian Mulroney's Airbus settlement because Mulroney was suing him for libel.

Dawson concluded that Thibault did have a private interest that he had failed to disclose and that he had contravened the Conflict of Interest Code for members of the House of Commons.

Conflict of Interest Act has plenty of loopholes

MPs later amended the code so that there could be an exception for someone in Thibault's position â€” that members who are party to a legal action are not considered to be furthering their own private interests when they take part in a debate on the same matter.

The Conflict of Interest Act, which governs cabinet ministers, states that members shall recuse themselves from any discussion, decision, debate or vote on any matter in respect of which they may be in a conflict of interest.

The code stipulates that MPs must disclose orally or in writing their private interest and register it with the clerk of the House. And MPs shouldn't vote or participate in matters on which they have a private interest.

The definition of a conflict, however, is quite broad, allowing any general discussion on a topic matter â€” pensions, for example â€” to be considered "general application" and therefore not a conflict.

The House of Commons has not amended the Conflict of Interest Act to close many key loopholes. Liberal MPs rejected an effort to do so â€” and to also condemn Morneau's actions â€” when they defeated an NDP motion Tuesday.
TITLE: Federal Ethics Commissioner Mary Dawson Has Never Proactively Checked If Ministers Are Following Rules

ADVERTISEMENTAbdul Karim Telgi, a convict in counterfeit stamp paper scam, who had been in a critical condition, has died in a Bengaluru hospital.
Telgi was in an inmate at the Parappana Agrahara Central Jailin Bengaluru, after being sentenced to 30 years rigorous imprisonment in connection to the multi-crore fake stamp paper scam.
Indian Express reported that Telgi was also undergoing treatment for HIV/AIDS.
DIG (Prisons) D Roopa had revealed in July that Telgi had been enjoying special privileges inside prison including massages by other inmates.
Telgi was convicted in 2007, along with others, for running a scam where he sold fake stamp papers to banks, insurance companies and brokerage firms.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Abdul Karim Telgi, a convict in counterfeit stamp paper scam, who had been in a critical condition, has died in a Bengaluru hospital.

The Hindu reported that Telgi was declared dead at 3:55 pm on Thursday even has he had been in hospital for the past one week for meningitis and multi organ failure.

Telgi was in an inmate at the Parappana Agrahara Central Jailin Bengaluru, after being sentenced to 30 years rigorous imprisonment in connection to the multi-crore fake stamp paper scam.

Indian Express reported that Telgi was also undergoing treatment for HIV/AIDS.

DIG (Prisons) D Roopa had revealed in July that Telgi had been enjoying special privileges inside prison including massages by other inmates.

Telgi was convicted in 2007, along with others, for running a scam where he sold fake stamp papers to banks, insurance companies and brokerage firms.

He was also fined Rs 202 crore for his crimes.
TITLE: Kingpin Of Fake Stamp Paper Scam, Abdul Karim Telgi, Dies In Bengaluru

"We always thought that the Aadhaar number will be our key to check fake beneficiaries.
Now, we don't know how to address this challenge with so many farmers showing the same Aadhaar number."
"We always thought that the Aadhaar number will be our key to check fake beneficiaries.
Now, we don't know how to address this challenge with so many farmers showing the same Aadhaar number.
TEXT:
An operator works on his table while enrolling villagers for the Unique Identification (UID) database system at an enrolment centre at Merta district in the desert Indian state of Rajasthan February 21, 2013.

ADVERTISEMENT

The Maharashtra government's attempt of online registration for loan waiver implementation has sent the authorities into a tizzy as names over 100 farmers have been found linked to a single Aadhaar number.

The state government had earlier stressed on online registration by farmers with their Aadhaar, which is a unique identification.

The government has said that the Aadhaar-based linking will avoid any duplication as well as fake accounts getting the benefit of the loan waiver.

A senior official from the Maharashtra cooperation department showed a list of potential beneficiaries of farmers having a common Aadhaar number, which has become a cause of concern for the government.

"We always thought that the Aadhaar number will be our key to check fake beneficiaries. Now, we don't know how to address this challenge with so many farmers showing the same Aadhaar number."

"We always thought that the Aadhaar number will be our key to check fake beneficiaries. Now, we don't know how to address this challenge with so many farmers showing the same Aadhaar number. If we have to carry out a manual check, which will take weeks. The farming community is already agitated over the delay in implementation of the scheme," the official said.

Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has called an urgent meeting with bankers today to address issues like this that crop up in the way of speedy implementation of the scheme.

Officials of some banks also admitted that the data they received from the online registration portal Aapale Sarkar - varies the data at their in their records.

Names Missing

The names of some farmers are missing and some do not match with the land size or type of loan.

"In many cases the principal amount and interest are not matching. It leads to suspicion. Unless the state officials have verified the account and its loan amount, we cannot consider that account for loan waiver," a senior official of a leading public sector bank.

The state government had last week released a sum of Rs 4,000 crore under the first phase of the over Rs 34,000 crore farm loan waiver scheme.

Responding to the Opposition's criticism against the online system of filling forms for availing the scheme, Fadnavis last week earlier said had that not been done, the banks would have mismanaged funds.

The Centre had earlier this year made Aadhaar mandatory for availing crop insurance policies.

As per the agriculture ministry's directive, banks were asked to persuade farmers to furnish Aadhaar identification card at the time of sanction/renewal/ disbursement/inspection of the loan or on visit at bank branches.
TITLE: Picture This: 100 Farmers, But All Linked To A Single Aadhaar Number

SUMMARY:
Dear readers,I am so pleased to announce "Listen to America," a hugely ambitious, cross-country project weâ€™re undertaking at HuffPost to understand whatâ€™s on the minds of Americans and what it means to be American in 2017.
Weâ€™ll listen to whatâ€™s most important to them, and help tell those stories to the vast HuffPost audience.
As we visit 25 cities, weâ€™ll use our bus â€” built out as a mobile video studio â€” to listen and collect hundreds if not thousands of voices, and weâ€™ll share many of them along the way.
Third, as journalists, being good listeners, and getting out of our own way, are at the core of our practice.
"Listen to America" is an opportunity to practice this skill over and over, and discover great stories out in the field, where they live.
TEXT:
Dear readers,

I am so pleased to announce "Listen to America," a hugely ambitious, cross-country project weâ€™re undertaking at HuffPost to understand whatâ€™s on the minds of Americans and what it means to be American in 2017. Consider this an invitation to our journey.

For journalists, listening is more important than ever. Why? First, trust in the news media is at an all-time low. We want to address that head-on, and build trust in the work we do, by visiting communities that are often ignored by national media. Weâ€™ll listen to whatâ€™s most important to them, and help tell those stories to the vast HuffPost audience.

Second, political divisions between us seem starker than ever. But at HuffPost, we believe thereâ€™s still so much that unites us as citizens. We aim to discover and highlight all that, and show what Americans have in common. As we visit 25 cities, weâ€™ll use our bus â€” built out as a mobile video studio â€” to listen and collect hundreds if not thousands of voices, and weâ€™ll share many of them along the way. Weâ€™ll also create ways for you to make your voice heard too, even if we arenâ€™t coming to your hometown.

Third, as journalists, being good listeners, and getting out of our own way, are at the core of our practice. "Listen to America" is an opportunity to practice this skill over and over, and discover great stories out in the field, where they live.

Weâ€™re popping our own bubbles in more ways than one. Join us! The bus hits the road on Sept. 12 in St. Louis. Check our map to see if weâ€™re coming to your town. Subscribe to our newsletter. And shoot us any tips or thoughts at listening@huffpost.com. Weâ€™re here.

Best,Lydia Polgreen
TITLE: Listen to America

Cette sÃ©rie pour adolescents crÃ©Ã©e par la scÃ©nariste de "Sex and the City" Terri Minsky est centrÃ©e autour du personnage d'Andi, 13 ans, qui tente de dÃ©terminer qui elle est et comment vivre sa vie.

"Terri Minsky, les acteurs et l'Ã©quipe de tournage ont eu Ã  cÅ“ur que (l'Ã©pisode) soit appropriÃ© pour tous les Ã¢ges et envoie un message puissant d'intÃ©gration et de respect", a commentÃ© une porte-parole de Disney dans un communiquÃ©.

SUMMARY:
The researchers asked adults to complete a personality test before answering survey questions about their sleeping habits.
According to a recent study, introverts are more likely to suffer from a poor nightâ€™s sleep than extroverts.
For the study, the researchers asked 1,000 people to complete the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) personality test.
In addition, extroverts are 6.5.% more satisfied with their ability to sleep through the night than their introverted counterparts.
But whether youâ€™re an introvert, an extrovert, or somewhere close to the middle of the scale, poor sleep doesnâ€™t have to be a fact of life.
TEXT:
Whatâ€™s more, the results indicated introverts have nightmares more often than their extraverted counterparts and are more likely to fall asleep during the day.

They found extroverts are 17.7% more satisfied with their levels of energy during the day than introverts.

The researchers asked adults to complete a personality test before answering survey questions about their sleeping habits.

Being an introvert could be behind your lack of energy. According to a recent study, introverts are more likely to suffer from a poor nightâ€™s sleep than extroverts.

The research was conducted by a team of researchers working on behalf of bed company Best Mattress Brand.

For the study, the researchers asked 1,000 people to complete the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) personality test.

The test is designed to reveal the characteristics of someoneâ€™s personality and as part of the results, a person is told whether they are an extrovert or introvert.

Under the test, extroversion and introversion are represented on a scale, but broadly speaking, extroverts prefer to focus on the outer world and take their energy from interaction with others, while introverts prefer to focus on their internal world and draw energy from quiet time alone.

After they were given a personality type, the researchers asked participants to share information about their sleeping patterns, levels of alertness and dreams.

Their results suggest extroverts are 17.7% more satisfied with their levels of energy during waking hours than introverts.

In addition, extroverts are 6.5.% more satisfied with their ability to sleep through the night than their introverted counterparts.

In comparison, introverts are also 14.8% less satisfied with the amount they feel alert during waking hours than extroverts.

These experiences may be related to the types of dreams that we have.

According to the data, extroverts have nightmares 8.3% less often than introverts. They are dream about their teeth falling out 14.2% less often and dream about punching something with no effect 14% less than introverts.

At the other end of the scale, the study found extroverts dream about traveling 13.9% more often than introverts.

With introverts struggling to have a restful nightâ€™s sleep, it appears many find it hard to keep their eyes open during the day.

Introverts are apparently 7.7% more likely to fall asleep when trying to stay awake than extroverts, which doesnâ€™t bode well for those Monday morning meetings.

The study did not delve into why these patterns may appear, but simply looked at the key statistics for each personality group.

But whether youâ€™re an introvert, an extrovert, or somewhere close to the middle of the scale, poor sleep doesnâ€™t have to be a fact of life.

Check out our top tips for getting a better nightâ€™s sleep here.
TITLE: How Being An Introvert Could Affect Your Sleep

The ring bear (yes, â€œbear,â€ which we lovingly took from â€œHow I Met Your Motherâ€) walked down with a pillow made in the form of â€œFellowship of the Ringâ€ (complete with the first page sewn in on the inside).

TEXT:
Our bridal party processional song was â€œConcerning Hobbitsâ€ from the â€œLord of the Ringsâ€ series. The ring bear (yes, â€œbear,â€ which we lovingly took from â€œHow I Met Your Motherâ€) walked down with a pillow made in the form of â€œFellowship of the Ringâ€ (complete with the first page sewn in on the inside).

The bridal march started, and everyone rose expecting to see me walking down the aisle â€• but then the record â€œscratched,â€ and the imperial march started. Three stormtroopers filed in on each side of the room, marched down side-by-side and took a place behind the bridal party. My dad and I were then escorted in by Darth Vader himself. (HUGE thank you to the 501st Legion for making that happen!)

We also wrote the ceremony ourselves, which was rife with jokes and references, and the whole thing was very personal and a total blast.
TITLE: Parents Surprise Couple With The Most Nerdtastic Wedding Portrait

SUMMARY:
If you haven't heard of Frank Body you're either a) not a female between the ages of 15-30, or b) not on Instagram.
#letsbefrank #thefrankeffect #freckles A post shared by frank body (@frank_bod) on Oct 16, 2017 at 8:04pm PDTThe early days of the business were, as most start-ups are, frantic.
They now have a combined waitlist of 90,000 for the new Shimmer Scrub.
"We are about to launch a new and improved version of the Shimmer Scrub with three times the shimmer of the first version, it's incredible."
As for what's coming next from Frank Body?
TEXT:
If you haven't heard of Frank Body you're either a) not a female between the ages of 15-30, or b) not on Instagram.

The Aussie beauty brand which was started by a few mates hand making products in their living room has grown since 2013 to become a $20 million-a-year company.

"We launched Frank Body in 2013 because we wanted to create affordable, beautiful natural products that did what they said they would and a brand that was unlike anything else in the market," co-founder Jess Hatzis told HuffPost Australia.

"We are a self-funded start-up, so trying to compete with the big existing beauty brands was going to be tough. We took a grassroots approach through social media, building a genuine relationship with our early consumers and growing that into what we now refer to as #thefrankeffect -- over 100,000 consumer images uploaded to Instagram."

Faux freckles. It's a thing. #letsbefrank #thefrankeffect #freckles A post shared by frank body (@frank_bod) on Oct 16, 2017 at 8:04pm PDT

The early days of the business were, as most start-ups are, frantic. It was all hands on deck.

"It was chaos. We were doing everything from making, packing and sending the scrub ourselves, to the marketing and finance -- everything it takes to start a new business. We brought on trusted friends as the business grew and we found an incredible manufacturer in Melbourne that specialise in natural products, although they had to develop a new facility for our scrubs because nothing existed like them. We sold our first million scrubs about 18 months after we launched -- that was the most unbelievable moment," Hatzis said.

Earlier this year the brand launched what would become a sell-out favourite, the Shimmer Scrub. It was one of the most popular products for 2017 and when it first launched with a pre-sale sign up, they had a waitlist of 50,000 customers.

"In mid-2016 we decided we wanted to create something that didn't exist, something that gave babes three products in one: scrubbing them, moisturising them and leaving shimmer on their bodies. In theory, it was great.

"In reality, it was going to be really difficult to find the perfect formula that let the shimmer cling to the skin after the scrub was rinsed off. We went through so many iterations of product development until we finally created a scrub that did exactly what we wanted it to," Hatzis said.

In May this year the product sold out online in just 10 days and was Frank Body's most successful launch to date. They now have a combined waitlist of 90,000 for the new Shimmer Scrub.

"We are about to launch a new and improved version of the Shimmer Scrub with three times the shimmer of the first version, it's incredible."

"We're also releasing two more shimmer products -- a creamy, buttery illuminator made with coconut oil, jojoba oil and a blend of silver and gold mica. It's beautiful and natural. The second product is called Magic Shimmer Oil: a dry oil with a shimmery blurring effect to be used from top to toe. It's not tinted, even though it looks like it is in the bottle -- that's the suspended mica particles."

For customers who want it, you've got to get on the waitlist.

"Everyone on the waitlist will be given priority access to shop before the general public and we're capping the Scrub purchases at three per person."

As for what's coming next from Frank Body? Were not privy to that info but what we do know for sure is that customers will lap it up.
TITLE: Frank Body Scrub: 90,000 People Want This Product

TEXT:
Los principales paÃ­ses del mundo â€”entre ellos EEUU, Alemania, Reino Unido y Franciaâ€” y destacadas instituciones como la UE, la ONU y la OTAN han expresado este viernes su rechazo a la independencia de CataluÃ±a y han mostrado su apoyo a la unidad de EspaÃ±a.

Tras la declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia aprobada este viernes por el Parlamento catalÃ¡n, los gobiernos y las cancillerÃ­as de los paÃ­ses mÃ¡s poderosos de la comunidad internacional han respaldado al Gobierno de Mariano Rajoy y han abogado por encontrar una soluciÃ³n dentro del orden constitucional espaÃ±ol.

EEUU: CATALUÃ‘A ES "PARTE INTEGRAL DE ESPAÃ‘A"

Estados Unidos ha dejado claro que "CataluÃ±a es una parte integral de EspaÃ±a" y ha asegurado que el Gobierno estadounidense apoya las medidas adoptadas por el Ejecutivo espaÃ±ol para mantener a EspaÃ±a "fuerte y unida".

"CataluÃ±a es una parte integral de EspaÃ±a, y Estados Unidos apoya las medidas constitucionales del Gobierno espaÃ±ol para mantener a EspaÃ±a fuerte y unida", ha dicho la portavoz del Departamento de Estado, Heather Nauert.

ALEMANIA: "LA SOBERANÃA E INTEGRIDAD DE ESPAÃ‘A SON Y SE MANTIENEN INVIOLABLES"

El Gobierno de Alemania ha asegurado por su parte que no reconoce la declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia aprobada por el Parlamento regional, al tiempo que ha subrayado su apoyo a las medidas adoptadas por el Gobierno de EspaÃ±a.

El portavoz del Ejecutivo alemÃ¡n, Steffen Seibert, ha afirmado a travÃ©s de un comunicado que su paÃ­s apoya la "clara postura" del presidente del Gobierno espaÃ±olen defensa del "orden constitucional", a la vez que ha subrayado que la "soberanÃ­a y la integridad territorial de EspaÃ±a son y se mantienen inviolables".

REINO UNIDO: "NI RECONOCEMOS NI RECONOCEREMOS LA DECLARACIÃ“N DE INDEPENDENCIA"

TambiÃ©n el Gobierno del Reino Unido ha dejado claro que "no reconoce ni reconocerÃ¡" la declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia de CataluÃ±a. "Seguimos queriendo ver cÃ³mo se preserva el imperio de la ley, se respeta la ConstituciÃ³n espaÃ±ola y se mantiene la unidad de EspaÃ±a", ha seÃ±alado un portavoz de la primera ministra britÃ¡nica, Theresa May.

Asimismo ha subrayado que esa declaraciÃ³n unilateral de independencia de la regiÃ³n de CataluÃ±a "estÃ¡ basada en una votaciÃ³n que fue declarada ilegal por tribunales espaÃ±oles".

FRANCIA: "RAJOY ES NUESTRO ÃšNICO INTERLOCUTOR CON ESPAÃ‘A"

El presidente de Francia, Emmanuel Macron, ha subrayado tambiÃ©n que el "Ãºnico interlocutor" de su paÃ­s con EspaÃ±a es el presidente del Gobierno espaÃ±ol, Mariano Rajoy, al tiempo que ha destacado que la situaciÃ³n en la regiÃ³n de CataluÃ±a es un "asunto interno" espaÃ±ol.

ITALIA NO RECONOCE LA DECLARACIÃ“N UNILATERAL

Italia tampoco reconoce "ni reconocerÃ¡" la declaraciÃ³n de independencia de CataluÃ±a, segÃºn ha afirmado el ministro de Exteriores italiano, Angelino Alfano, a la vez que ha calificado esa decisiÃ³n del Parlamento de esa comunidad autÃ³noma de "gesto gravÃ­simo y fuera del marco de la ley".

TUSK: "PARA LA UNIÃ“N NO CAMBIA NADA"

En la misma lÃ­nea se ha pronunciado el presidente del Consejo Europeo, Donald Tusk, quien ha asegurado que EspaÃ±a sigue siendo el "Ãºnico interlocutor" de la UniÃ³n Europea, al tiempo que ha afirmado que para la UniÃ³n "nada cambia".

For EU nothing changes. Spain remains our only interlocutor. I hope the Spanish government favours force of argument, not argument of force.
TITLE: La comunidad internacional no reconoce la independencia de CataluÃ±a

There are dozens of biking and hiking trails across Casper Mountain, or you can take a ride down the North Platte River.

TEXT:
Rolling into week six of our Listen To America road trip, HuffPost took a breath of fresh air in Casper, Wyoming.

Many come to Casper to experience the great outdoors, which you can enjoy any number of ways. There are dozens of biking and hiking trails across Casper Mountain, or you can take a ride down the North Platte River. Casper appeals to all sorts of fishers, ski fans and adrenaline junkies.

The cityâ€™s trails arenâ€™t just enjoyable and gorgeous â€• theyâ€™re also historical! Casper was once the only point of convergence between the Oregon, California, Mormon and Pony Express trails.

HuffPost is hitting the road this fall to interview people about their hopes, dreams, fears â€• and what it means to be American today.

HuffPost hiked and ventured around Casper, stopping by David Street Station to talk to locals. We also held a panel at Frontier Brewing Company about what Wyoming schools can do for funds in a post-bust economy. You can take a look at our time in Casper below:
TITLE: Hikes, Bikes & Sights: HuffPostâ€™s Listen To America Tour Stops In Casper

SUMMARY:
Just look at Alyssa Healy's form as she hit a beautiful six in the second One Day match in the women's Ashes series at Coffs Harbour.
You'd have to say "WHOOSH" or something that coveys silky smoothness rather than a furious flurry of activity.
Healy was out for 56 a few overs after hitting that sublime six but the opening batter had done her job.
After 35 overs, Australia had reached 3-170.
They were after 3/246 after 45 overs, the acceleration thanks largely to hitting like this from Rachael Haynes.
TEXT:
Just look at Alyssa Healy's form as she hit a beautiful six in the second One Day match in the women's Ashes series at Coffs Harbour.

The calm stance. The impeccable timing. The sheer effortlessness of it all.

If this was a cartoon, you couldn't accompany Healy's shot with a word like "OOF!" or "BAM!" You'd have to say "WHOOSH" or something that coveys silky smoothness rather than a furious flurry of activity.

Healy was out for 56 a few overs after hitting that sublime six but the opening batter had done her job. As she told Channel Nine on the boundary afterwards, "it would have been nice to go on with it, but I'm happy we got off to a good start".

Here's another view of the six. We've seen more energetic blocks.

Australia was 1-98 when Healy fell on the last ball of the 20th over. The team then appeared well on track to reach a score of 260 or more, but they ended up soaring past that -- reaching 6-296. Weather threatened to play a part in the England chase, with storms in the Coffs Harbour area, but rain and a bit of hail had the common good sense to fall during the dinner break.

After 35 overs, Australia had reached 3-170. They were after 3/246 after 45 overs, the acceleration thanks largely to hitting like this from Rachael Haynes.

And this.

And this from Ellyse Perry.

Six more! Perry and Haynes taking it in turns of clearing the boundary.



Get to a TV @9Gem now! #WomensAshes pic.twitter.com/vruOrbKprE â€” Australia Women ğŸ (@SouthernStars) 26 de outubro de 2017

And this, also from Perry.

Not that it was all about from ball striking. Look at this little inventive ramp shot from Rachael Haynes. It really has been a cricket clinic out there in Coffs Harbour this Thursday. Four Australians passed 50 in a great team batting performance.

In reply England lost wickets steadily and were all out for 209 in the 43rd over. Megan Schutt was the chief destroyer for the Aussies, taking 4-26. Australia won by by 86 runs. The full scorecard is here.

You can also watch the game live on Gem -- which we highly recommend because Australia's batting performance thus far really has been excellent.

Meanwhile in exciting news for cricket fans and for the women's game more generally, Nine had such good ratings with the first Ashes match last Sunday, they're screening the third One-Dayer this coming Sunday on the main channel.

"We are proud to announce that we will be airing at least two matches from the CommBank Women's Ashes Series live and free on the Nine prime channel," Nine's Head of Cricket Brent Williams said.

"The Australian and English sides are the top two ranked sides in the world, and the Aussies are the current holder of The Ashes, so we encourage the nation to get behind them to beat the Poms."

And when trying to beat said English visitors, what better way to do it than with maximum nonchalance and minimum sweat -- a la Alyssa Healy?

Or with yet more power hitting from Haynes? BAM!
TITLE: This Might Be The Most Nonchalant Six We've Ever Seen Anyone Hit
Vegan Leben

SUMMARY:
Jeremy Corbyn can become Prime Minister by swinging just a few hundred voters towards Labour in 45 small towns across the UK, research from a new think tank has found.
The study found that 45 marginal Westminster seats are dominated by small towns that have been neglected by successive governments and have borne the brunt of Britainâ€™s de-industrialisation for decades.
Here is our UK map showing the 5,000-plus places we'll be including in our research.
Labourâ€™s â€˜Corbyn surgeâ€™ in the 2017 election saw the party win back â€˜town seatsâ€™ such as Bedford, Warwick, Portsmouth South and Lincoln.
Wiganâ€™s Labour MP Lisa Nandy, who has toured the country to assess the issues faced by small towns, told HuffPost UK that Labour canâ€™t win without changing its approach.
TEXT:
Jeremy Corbyn can become Prime Minister by swinging just a few hundred voters towards Labour in 45 small towns across the UK, research from a new think tank has found. Analysis for Centre For Towns, to be launched next month, suggests that Corbyn can win the keys to Downing Street if he and his party can break out of their â€œMetropolitanâ€ base in Britainâ€™s big cities. Early findings by the group of leading political and social scientists, released exclusively to HuffPost UK, show that Labour can take power from the Tories by addressing the concerns of votes in urban areas often seen as remote from London and other big conurbations. The study found that 45 marginal Westminster seats are dominated by small towns that have been neglected by successive governments and have borne the brunt of Britainâ€™s de-industrialisation for decades. These so-called â€œtown seatsâ€, a new electoral definition where most of the electorate live in a town, have average majorities of just 734 votes each, according to the analysis of Parliamentary results from 2015 and 2017.

PA Wire/PA Images Jeremy Corbyn campaigning in Telford.

The 45 key marginals make up a crucial chunk of the 76 swing seats with majorities below 2,000 votes and are set to determine the outcome of the next general election. Following the June electionâ€™s switch back to a largely â€˜two-partyâ€™ system, most big cities in England are now packed with solid Labour seats, while rural areas are the almost exclusive preserve of the Tories. As a result, several MPs believe Corbyn needs to change Labourâ€™s image as a â€œMetropolitanâ€ party and win back areas which either voted â€˜Leaveâ€™ in the Brexit referendum or have drifted away to the Tories over the years. Centre for Towns will unveil more data on an interactive website that brings together the largest single town-based data set in the UK, tracking everything from demographic make ups and social attitudes, to home ownership and election trends.

Here is our UK map showing the 5,000-plus places we'll be including in our research. Zoom in and look around: https://t.co/Zfy5SMXKN8 â€” Centre For Towns (@centrefortowns) October 26, 2017

The brand new think tank has been created to address what its founders see as the current lack of research and focus on the small towns in England, Wales and Scotland that are often dismissed as â€œleft behindâ€ by globalisation. Among its contributors are Manchester Universityâ€™s Professor Rob Ford and Dr Maria Sobolewska and Southampton Universityâ€™s Dr Will Jennings. Elections analyst Ian Warren is another key figure behind the Centre. Big urban populations are already served by their own independent research group, Centre for Cities, which has existed since 2005, but the founders of the new think tank believe a more tailored approach is required to meet the specific needs of towns.

PA Wire/PA Images Hastings and Rye MP, Home Secretary Amber Rudd.

Labourâ€™s â€˜Corbyn surgeâ€™ in the 2017 election saw the party win back â€˜town seatsâ€™ such as Bedford, Warwick, Portsmouth South and Lincoln. But next time it needs to clinch constituencies such as Thurrock, Hastings (held by Amber Rudd), Norwich North, Stoke on Trent South, Telford, Northampton North and Pendle where tiny vote swings would ensure it becomes the largest party in a hung Parliament. The Tory party has built an electoral power base in many of Englandâ€™s towns, and its strategists believe its success is in part due to Labour being seen as out of touch with their residentsâ€™ values. Labour still has a mountain to climb to win an outright majority, needing a big swing in key marginals, but becoming the largest party would allow Corbyn to seek to form a government with the support of smaller parties. Wiganâ€™s Labour MP Lisa Nandy, who has toured the country to assess the issues faced by small towns, told HuffPost UK that Labour canâ€™t win without changing its approach. â€œCities have dominated decision making for decades. After Brexit it is clear that this status quo is completely unsustainable,â€ she said.

Ben Pruchnie via Getty Images Labour MP Lisa Nandy.
TITLE: Jeremy Corbyn 'Can Become PM' If He Wins A Few Hundred Votes In Small Towns Battleground - New Research

TEXT:
Las amenazas de Donald Trump y la rÃ­gida postura del equipo de Estados Unidos en la renegociaciÃ³n del TLCAN han tirado al peso a la lona este aÃ±o, pero el Banco de MÃ©xico tiene un as bajo la manga para que la moneda no se debilite tanto y que hasta ahora ha dado resultados.

Luego de que concluyera la mÃ¡s difÃ­cil de las rondas de negociaciones del TLCAN la semana pasada, el peso comenzÃ³ a cotizar a sus peores niveles en mÃ¡s de seis meses. El lunes 23, el escenario no parecÃ­a alentador: el dÃ³lar fortalecido se cotizaba en casi 19 pesos por billete verde.

Ante este escenario, el Banco de MÃ©xico anunciÃ³ el miÃ©rcoles que aumentarÃ­a a 4 mil millones de dÃ³lares el monto a subastar dentro de su programa de coberturas cambiarias en parcialidades por semana, empezando con mil millones de dÃ³lares el jueves 26 de octubre.

Â¿El resultado? El peso se recuperÃ³ de sus mÃ­nimos de seis meses. La cotizaciÃ³n pasÃ³ de 19.23 pesos por dÃ³lar el martes a 19.05 el miÃ©rcoles y, a mediodÃ­a del jueves, 18.55. Sin embargo, la moneda cerrÃ³ la jornada en 19.22 con una depreciaciÃ³n debido a la aprobaciÃ³n de plan presupuestario 2018 en EU.

"El anuncio fue una buena decisiÃ³n, en el sentido de decir: 'vamos a tener un periodo de volatilidad resultado de estos eventos'. La decisiÃ³n de aumentar las subastas tiene como intenciÃ³n atacar ese tema", dijo Sergio de Luna, director de Estudios EconÃ³micos de Citibanamex.

Pero, Â¿cÃ³mo funciona esta herramienta y quÃ© tanto podrÃ­a depreciarse el peso si el TLCAN llega a su fin?

Subasta de billetes verdes

Las coberturas cambiarias son un instrumento que el Banco de MÃ©xico puede utilizar para, entre otras cosas, contener la volatilidad en el tipo de cambio del peso contra el dÃ³lar estadounidense.

Existen varios tipos de coberturas, pero las que empezaron a subastarse desde el 21 de febrero de este aÃ±o son coberturas liquidables, lo que significa que Banxico vende los dÃ³lares a un tipo de cambio pactado con los bancos que las compran, con lo que el banco central solo absorbe la diferencia en pesos.

"La cobertura cambiaria se ha convertido en una herramienta interesante que no sÃ³lo reduce el riesgo, sino que permite realizar operaciones a futuro con un tipo de cambio fijo", segÃºn el estudio El abc de las coberturas cambiarias en MÃ©xico de BBVA Bancomer.

En lo que va del aÃ±o, Banxico ha utilizado esta herramienta en dos periodos. El primero en marzo con seis subastas cambiarias entre el 2 y el 6 de marzo; el segundo en octubre con siete subastas, incluida la que se llevÃ³ a cabo ayer, entre el 26 de octubre y el 6 de diciembre.

Y si el TLCAN se acaba...

Aunque Trump con la renegociaciÃ³n del TLCAN le ha dado algunos golpes al peso, la moneda no se depreciarÃ¡ a niveles tan drÃ¡sticos como en noviembre de 2016, cuando el republicano gano las elecciones presidenciales, y la cotizaciÃ³n llegÃ³ a los 22 pesos por dÃ³lar.

La razÃ³n detrÃ¡s de que el peso no llegarÃ¡ a esos niveles es que ahora, con las negociaciones andando, no existe el mismo factor sorpresa que en las presidenciales, cuando muchas encuestas habÃ­an dado el triunfo a Clinton y no a Trump.

"Este tipo de movimientos son no lineales. Pasamos de un estado de "no riesgo" a uno de riesgo", dijo director de Estudios EconÃ³micos de Citibanamex. "Ahora que el mercado ya vio que estas negociaciones son complejas habrÃ¡ volatilidad".

Sin embargo, el economista ve dos seÃ±ales favorables que podrÃ­an ayudar a controlar la volatilidad en el tipo de cambio: las subastas cambiarias, que dan liquidez al mercado y cierta tranquilidad, y las tasas de interÃ©s.

"La tasa objetivo de Banxico estÃ¡ en 7%, eso te hace mucho mÃ¡s costoso poner una posiciÃ³n en contra de la moneda mexicana. SÃ­ pensamos que va a haber volatilidad asociado a estas negociaciones, pero tampoco pensamos que se acelera aÃºn mÃ¡s", dijo.

Pero incluso en un escenario muy adverso en que el TLCAN desaparece, el economista Sergio de Luna cree que el tipo de cambio no rebasarÃ¡ las cotizaciones de noviembre de 2016.

"Si hubiera este escenario adverso tendrÃ­amos una sobrerreacciÃ³n del mercado, pero eventualmente se deberÃ­a tranquilizar", dijo. "Cuando tuvimos las mayores sorpresas con la elecciÃ³n del presidente Trump llegamos a estar en $22 pesos por dolar, lo que vemos ahora son mercados asignÃ¡ndole una probabilidad a eventos adversos".

El economista explicÃ³ que por esa razÃ³n el peso no se depreciarÃ¡ a los niveles en que lo hizo tras la elecciÃ³n del presidente de Estados Unidos. Esto significa que la cotizaciÃ³n estarÃ¡ debajo de 22 pesos por dÃ³lar.

SUMMARY:
Barnaby Joyce has apologised to his constituents in New England and pledged to continue to serve them after his election to the Federal Parliament was found invalid by the High Court of Australia on Friday.
"I would like to apologise for the inconvenience that will happen by reason of having a by-election, which we will go to almost immediately.
"Nick, he got back but he still wants to go so I don't know how you deal with that.
MORE: https://t.co/6Iop0LH7gp pic.twitter.com/pP9srxJTkT â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 27, 2017Joyce's citizenship was thrown into doubt in August when it was revealed that he is a New Zealand citizen by reason of descent.
@TurnbullMalcolm: New England will have its say on the 2nd of December, @Barnaby_Joyce is raring to go.
TEXT:
Barnaby Joyce has apologised to his constituents in New England and pledged to continue to serve them after his election to the Federal Parliament was found invalid by the High Court of Australia on Friday.

The now former Deputy Prime Minister told media that he respects the verdict that deemed him ineligible to serve the Coalition and now faces a by-election in his northern New South Wales electorate of New England, which is expected to occur around December 2.

"The first thing I want to say is that I want to thank the people of New England for the support I have been receiving, overwhelming support," he said.

"I would like to apologise for the inconvenience that will happen by reason of having a by-election, which we will go to almost immediately.

"I will be making sure that now we offer the people of New England the best service and continue on with jobs such as the relocation of the APVMA (the Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority), Scone Bypass, the 37 new upgraded mobile phone towers in the area, the bridges through newer programs, whether it is the Carrara or Middlebrook Bridge."

Despite his disappointment over the ruling, he also tried to keep part of his address to the media light-hearted -- even joking about the possibility of swapping places with Independent senator Nick Xenophon, who was found eligible to sit in Parliament but has already flagged his intention to quit Federal politics and run in the South Australian state election next March.

"Nick, he got back but he still wants to go so I don't know how you deal with that. Nick, do you want to swap mate?" he said.

.@Barnaby_Joyce asks @Nick_Xenophon if he wants to trade places, seeing as he is leaving federal parliament. MORE: https://t.co/6Iop0LH7gp pic.twitter.com/pP9srxJTkT â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 27, 2017

Joyce's citizenship was thrown into doubt in August when it was revealed that he is a New Zealand citizen by reason of descent. His father was born in New Zealand and, despite being born in Australia and having never applied for NZ citizenship, the country claimed him as a citizen -- ultimately leading to the High Court's ruling on Friday.

While the ruling initially put the Turnbull government's slim majority in the Lower House at risk, Independent MP Cathy McGowan promised the Coalition she would support it on supply and confidence.

And as for Joyce and his role -- he said he's still committed to getting back to work in the hopes of winning the upcoming by-election, with Northern Territory Senator Nigel Scullion filling his place as interim leader of the National Party and Deputy PM.

"It is a tough game, politics. You dedicate so much of your time to it and you take the hits and the sacrifices. We all buy the ticket, we know the risks," he said.

"Now I am going to make sure that I don't cry in my beer, I will get back at work and work hard for the people in my electorate, the electorate of New England, and make sure I do the best job for my nation."

Senator Nigel Scullion will be the temporary Parliamentary leader for @The_Nationals until @Barnaby_Joyce faces a by election @SkyNewsAust â€” Laura Jayes (@ljayes) October 27, 2017

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull also addressed Joyce's ineligibility by jumping to his defence for the upcoming vote, saying he is the best suited person to serve "Australians living in regional, remote and rural areas".

"Barnaby Joyce is the best person, as we've seen already on the television complete with his hat, the best person to deliver for New England and for Australians living in regional, remote and rural areas," he said.

"He has a passion for representation and, while I know that Barnaby will be disappointed with the outcome of the court case, it's as though he's been let out of the stalls and he's ready and rearing to go. His enthusiasm is absolutely infectious."

.@TurnbullMalcolm: New England will have its say on the 2nd of December, @Barnaby_Joyce is raring to go. MORE: https://t.co/6Iop0LH7gp pic.twitter.com/dPpgt2EHdV â€” Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) October 27, 2017

Joyce was first elected as the Member for the New England electorate back in 2013 and was re-elected at the 2016 election after winning more than 52 percent of the ballot.
TITLE: Barnaby Joyce Has Been Ruled Out By The High Court. Now A By-Election Looms And A Campaign To Get Straight Back In

SUMMARY:
Patrick Chan goes through his routine during a practice session at Skate Canada International in Regina on Thursday, Oct. 26, 2017.
REGINA â€” Patrick Chan finally arrived at Skate Canada International.
The three-time world figure skating champion missed Thursday morning's practice after his flight out of Detroit on Wednesday was delayed.
Chan, who's aiming for his seventh Skate Canada International title, said the hectic two days of travel are "a good test."
Chan, who won silver at the 2014 Sochi Games, will compete in his third and final Olympics in Pyeonchang.
TEXT:
Patrick Chan goes through his routine during a practice session at Skate Canada International in Regina on Thursday, Oct. 26, 2017.

REGINA â€” Patrick Chan finally arrived at Skate Canada International. His costumes didn't.

The three-time world figure skating champion missed Thursday morning's practice after his flight out of Detroit on Wednesday was delayed. He missed his connection in Toronto, and spent the night there before flying to Regina on Thursday.

He practised early Thursday evening, in track pants and a short-sleeved workout top, but his luggage had yet to arrive.

"I luckily packed my skates and practice clothes (in his carry-on)," Chan said. "I don't have my costumes though, I might have to borrow a shirt from a skater, luckily I have friends here."

The 26-year-old from Toronto said TSA allows skates in carry-on luggage in North America.

Chan, who's aiming for his seventh Skate Canada International title, said the hectic two days of travel are "a good test."

"It's frustrating," he said. "Like anybody, I don't want to put myself in a situation where I'm running around like a dog at the airport trying to get on a plane. It's a bit ridiculous. But that's travel, you can't really control that, and I kind of look at it as an opportunity.

"It actually relaxes me a little, honestly now that I'm here, just roll with the punches. If I don't have a costume, I don't have a costume, I'll just show up and that's all I can do, right? It's a good adventure."

'It's all good, all good'

Chan is keeping fingers cross his luggage arrives before he skates his short program to "Dust in the Wind" by Kansas early Friday evening. His long program to Jeff Buckley's "Hallelujah" is Saturday.

"It's not the Olympics or world championships, then I would be kicking myself," he said. "It's all good, all good."

Chan, who won silver at the 2014 Sochi Games, will compete in his third and final Olympics in Pyeonchang.
TITLE: Patrick Chan Arrives Late To Skate Canada, But Without His Costumes

TEXT:
Activist Gloria Steinem and actress Jane Fonda appeared on MSNBCâ€™s â€œAll In With Chris Hayesâ€ Wednesday night to discuss the mounting allegations of sexual harassment, assault and rape against Harvey Weinstein.

The duo appeared as spokespeople for The Womenâ€™s Media Center, a non-profit which Fonda and Steinem co-founded with poet Robin Morgan in 2005. Fonda pointed out that while the Weinstein accusations are a watershed moment for our culture when it comes to sexual harassment, it only happened because most of his accusers are famous white women (with the exception of Lupita Nyongâ€™o).

â€œIt feels like something has shifted,â€ Fonda told Hayes. â€œItâ€™s too bad that itâ€™s probably because so many of the women that were assaulted by Harvey Weinstein are famous and white and everybody knows them. This has been going on a long time to black women and other women of color and it doesnâ€™t get out quite the same.â€

Weinstein has been accused of sexual misconduct by over 60 women including allegations of sexual harassment, assault and rape. The Hollywood heavyweight has since been fired from his television and movie studio The Weinstein Company and is being investigated by police in London and New York.

Steinem said that there is power in numbers, especially in instances of sexual violence.
TITLE: Jane Fonda: People Are Listening Now Because Weinstein Victims Are 'Famous And White'

Le prÃ©sident amÃ©ricain a donnÃ© six mois aux services de renseignement, jusqu'au 26 avril 2018, pour Ã©plucher les documents jugÃ©s sensibles et en censurer, le cas Ã©chÃ©ant, les parties les plus dÃ©licates. "Je n'ai pas d'autre choix, aujourd'hui, que d'accepter qu'on les Ã©tudie plutÃ´t que de permettre une atteinte potentiellement irrÃ©versible Ã  la sÃ©curitÃ© de notre nation", a-t-il soulignÃ©.

"Au terme de ce dÃ©lai, j'ordonnerai la publication de toutes informations dont les services n'auront pas pu dÃ©montrer" qu'elles devaient Ãªtre tenues secrÃ¨tes, a martelÃ© le prÃ©sident, qui est lui-mÃªme par le passÃ© entrÃ© dans le jeu des thÃ©ories et fantasmes autour de cet assassinat.

"Le prÃ©sident veut s'assurer qu'il y a une complÃ¨te transparence" et "veut publier ces informations (manquantes) aussi vite que possible", a affirmÃ© un des responsables, qui s'exprimait sous couvert de l'anonymat.

Mais "il reste des informations sensibles dans les dossiers", a soulignÃ© ce dernier, notamment sur des informateurs et "des activitÃ©s menÃ©es avec le soutien d'organisations Ã©trangÃ¨res partenaires, des services de renseignement ou de police".

"DÃ©truits ou dissimulÃ©s"

Une commission d'enquÃªte lancÃ©e quelques jours aprÃ¨s la mort du charismatique prÃ©sident de 46 ans, la commission Warren, avait conclu que "JFK" avait Ã©tÃ© tuÃ© par l'ancien Marine tireur d'Ã©lite Lee Harvey Oswald, ayant agi seul.

Cette position officielle n'a pourtant jamais suffi Ã  Ã©touffer les hypothÃ¨ses sur un complot ourdi contre le 35e prÃ©sident amÃ©ricain Ã  Dallas, au Texas.

Des centaines d'ouvrages et de films ont alimentÃ© la thÃ¨se du complot, pointant du doigt les adversaires de la Guerre froide qu'Ã©taient l'Union soviÃ©tique et Cuba, la mafia et mÃªme le vice-prÃ©sident Lyndon B. Johnson.

Des hypothÃ¨ses qui avaient repris un nouveau souffle aprÃ¨s la sortie du film "JFK" d'Oliver Stone en 1991. Face au dÃ©bat public alors dÃ©cuplÃ©, une loi avait Ã©tÃ© signÃ©e en 1992 imposant la publication de tous ces documents, en intÃ©gralitÃ© et sans censure, aprÃ¨s 25 ans. Mais leur divulgation risque de ne pas suffire Ã  faire taire mÃªme les thÃ¨ses les plus folles.

"Quiconque pense qu'un document est intitulÃ© 'Membres de la conspiration pour tuer le prÃ©sident Kennedy' va attendre longtemps", a ironisÃ© Larry Sabato, professeur de sciences politiques Ã  l'universitÃ© de Virginie et auteur de "The Kennedy Half-Century".

Mais pour ceux qui veulent croire au complot, les dossiers maintenus secrets seront "considÃ©rÃ©s comme la Pierre de Rosette", a-t-il reconnu. "Cela va simplement alimenter encore plus les thÃ©ories conspirationnistes".

Gerald Posner, auteur de "Case Closed" ayant conclu qu'Oswald avait agi seul, s'attendait Ã  la mÃªme rÃ©action. "Personne ne va abandonner sa conviction qu'un complot a Ã©tÃ© ourdi parce que la publication des dossiers ne le prouve pas", a-t-il dÃ©clarÃ© Ã  l'AFP. "Ils diront simplement qu'ils ont Ã©tÃ© dÃ©truits ou dissimulÃ©s".
